Key Arguments: The determination of what constitutes misinformation and disinformation is subjective and can change over time, as scientific understanding evolves.
Australians are capable of discerning truth from misinformation without government intervention.
The proposed legislation exempts government and mainstream media, which is seen as unfair and reminiscent of authoritarian regimes.
The legislation could lead to a slippery slope towards limiting free speech, akin to practices in communist countries.
There is a question about the legal authority or 'Head of Power' for the Parliament to enact this legislation.
Notable Quotes: Who determines what is misinformation and Disinformation? (What is truth and what is not truth) as science is forever changing...
We as Australians do not need the Government or an external Body to treat us like children...
Allowing only Mainstream media as an exemption is dangerous as this is what happens in communist countries.
This proposed legislation is the beginning of a slippery slope toward communism in my view.
